item.description:
Tommy Priester Foraging for Wild Foods and Herbs, in your own back yard

* Save on your grocery bill and eat fresh, delicious nourishing greens from your own back yard.
* You will learn to use herbs to heal all sorts of accute injuries, viruses, colds flu's, sprains, cuts, bruises, histeria, shock and all kinds of traumas, with simple plants, herbs and homeopathics remedies.

Special Feature: Herbal Walk 4 - 5 pm Limited to 20. Only $10. To reserve your space, mail check payable to Optimum Health Solution to OHS, 337 Newton St. #4, Waltham, MA 02453.

Tommy Priester is a Clinical Herbalist Wellness Counselor and Bear Medicine Herbs Founder and Herbalist www.bearmedicineherbs.com. Tommy, a practicing herbalist since 1998, combines extensive knowledge of Western Herbalism, nutrition and diet with ancient wisdom traditions from Native American and other cultures. You will love his wisdom and his open, compassionate understanding and gentle, peaceful energy.

When: Tuesday, June 15

Registration 5:30 PM

Gourmet Plant-Based "Living Food" Potluck - 6:00 - 7:00 pm

Presentation and Q and A 7:00 - 8:30 pm

Where: New venue - Fellowship Hall at The United Methodist Church of Newton, across from Newton North High School, 430 Walnut Street, Newtonville, MA 02460 Driving directions www.gbgm-umc.org/newtnumc. A short walk from the MBTA stop. Handicap Accessible. Parking available.

Contribution: $20 of which $10 is a tax-deductible contribution to Optimum Health Solution's new project - membership scholarships and CSA shares to newly established "Healthy Living" 4 H Club, based on the Hippocrates Approach to Optimum Health. Pay at the door. No reservations necessary.

What to Bring: a raw organic, unprocessed, ready to serve dish for 8 with labeled utensils or pay an extra $10. So sufficient will be prepared, if you are unable to bring a dish, please email Betsy@OptimumHealthSolution.org. Volunteers welcome to prepare food.

posted by www.essenic.org
item.name: OHS Potluck / Speaker: Tommy Priester
